lecturers and 419 institutions of higher education.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEde_MoraWood201455_353-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEde_MoraWood201455-353">[347]</a></sup> A number of foreign universities operate private campuses in Vietnam, including <a href="/wiki/Harvard_University" title="Harvard University">Harvard University</a> (USA) and the <a href="/wiki/RMIT_University_Vietnam" title="RMIT University Vietnam">Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology</a> (Australia). The government\'s strong commitment to education has fostered significant growth but still need to be sustained to retain academics. In 2018, a decree on university autonomy to operate independently without a ministry control above their heads are in its final stages of approval with the government will continue to investing in education especially for the poor to have access on basic education.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEVietnam_Net2016b_354-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVietnam_Net2016b-354">[348]</a></sup>\n</p><h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Demographics">Demographics</span></h2>\n<div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Vietnam" title="Demographics of Vietnam">Demographics of Vietnam</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vietnamese_people" title="Vietnamese people">Vietnamese people</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnic_groups_in_Vietnam" title="Ethnic groups in Vietnam">Ethnic groups in Vietnam</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="505" data-file-width="760" decoding="async" height="146" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg/220px-Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg/330px-Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg/440px-Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Vietnamese_cultural_dance.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Folk_dance" title="Folk dance">Cultural dance</a> performed by one of <a href="/wiki/List_of_ethnic_groups_in_Vietnam" title="List of ethnic groups in Vietnam">54 recognised Vietnamese ethnic groups</a>.</div></div></div>\n<table class="wikitable" style="float: right; margin-left: 10px">\n<tbody><tr>\n<th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background:#cfb;">Population<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEUnited_Nations_Department_of_Economic_and_Social_Affairs_7-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEUnited_Nations_Department_of_Economic_and_Social_Affairs-7">[5]</a></sup>\n</th></tr>\n<tr>\n<th style="background:#cfb;">Year\n</th>\n<th style="background:#cfb;">Million\n</th></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:left;">1950</td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">24.8\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:left;">2000</td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">80.3\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:left;">2016</td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">94.6\n</td></tr></tbody></table>\n<p>As of  2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vietnam&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, the population of Vietnam standing at approximately 94.6 million people.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEUnited_Nations_Department_of_Economic_and_Social_Affairs_7-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEUnited_Nations_Department_of_Economic_and_Social_Affairs-7">[5]</a></sup> The population had grown significantly from the 1979 census, which showed the total population of reunified Vietnam to be 52.7 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESE1980_355-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESE1980-355">[349]</a></sup> In 2012, the country\'s population was estimated at approximately 90.3 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131_356-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131-356">[350]</a></sup> Based on the 2009 census, 70.4% of the Vietnamese population are living in rural areas while only 29.6% living in urban areas although the average growth rate of the urban population have recently increasing which mainly attributed to migration and rapid urbanisation.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009a_357-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009a-357">[351]</a></sup> The dominant <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Viet_people" title="Viet people">Viet</a> or Kinh ethnic group constituted nearly 73.6 million people or 85.8% of the population,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131_356-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131-356">[350]</a></sup> with most of their population is concentrated mainly in the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Alluvial_fans" title="Alluvial fans">alluvial deltas</a> and coastal plains of the country. As a majority ethnic group, the Kinh possess significant political and economic influence over the country.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEJones199821_358-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJones199821-358">[352]</a></sup> Despite this, Vietnam is also home to other 54 ethnic minority groups, including the <a href="/wiki/Hmong_people" title="Hmong people">Hmong</a>, <a href="/wiki/Yao_people" title="Yao people">Dao</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tay_people" title="Tay people">T&#224;y</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thai_people" title="Thai people">Thai</a> and <a href="/wiki/N%C3%B9ng_people" title="N&#249;ng people">N&#249;ng</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131_356-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECanada_Ministry_of_Citizenship_and_Immigration20131-356">[350]</a></sup> Many ethnic minorities such as the <a href="/wiki/Muong_people" title="Muong people">Muong</a> who are closely related to the Kinh dwell in the highlands which cover two-thirds of Vietnam\'s territory.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGovernment_of_Vietnam_359-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGovernment_of_Vietnam-359">[353]</a></sup>\n</p><p>Other uplanders in the north migrated from southern China between 1300s and 1800s.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEKoskoff20081316_360-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKoskoff20081316-360">[354]</a></sup> Since the partition of Vietnam, the population of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Central_Highlands_(Vietnam)" title="Central Highlands (Vietnam)">Central Highlands</a> was almost exclusively <a href="/wiki/Degar" title="Degar">Degar</a> (including over 40 tribal groups); however, the South Vietnamese government at the time enacted a program of resettling Kinh in indigenous areas.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECultural_Orientation_Resource_Centre7_361-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECultural_Orientation_Resource_Centre7-361">[355]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMontagnard_Human_Rights_Organisation_362-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMontagnard_Human_Rights_Organisation-362">[356]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Hoa_people" title="Hoa people">Hoa</a> (ethnic <a href="/wiki/Overseas_Chinese" title="Overseas Chinese">Chinese</a>) and <a href="/wiki/Khmer_Krom" title="Khmer Krom">Khmer Krom</a> people are mainly lowlanders.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEJones199821_358-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJones199821-358">[352]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEKoskoff20081316_360-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKoskoff20081316-360">[354]</a></sup> Throughout Vietnam history, many Chinese people mainly from <a href="/wiki/South_China" title="South China">South China</a> migrated to the country as administrators, merchants and even refugees.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEDoddLewis2003531_363-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEDoddLewis2003531-363">[357]</a></sup> Since the reunification in 1976 with the increase of communist policies nationwide that resulting the nationalisation of property and subsequently causing many rich people property in the city especially among the Hoa in the south are being confiscated by the government, this has led many of them to leave Vietnam.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEAmer1996_364-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEAmer1996-364">[358]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFeinberg2016_365-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFeinberg2016-365">[359]</a></sup> Furthermore, with the deteriorating <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sino-Vietnamese_relations" title="Sino-Vietnamese relations">Sino-Vietnamese relations</a> as a result of <a href="/wiki/Sino-Vietnamese_War" title="Sino-Vietnamese War">border invasion</a> by Chinese government in 1979 which added by doubtful among Vietnamese society on the Chinese government intention had indirectly causing more Hoa people in the north to leave the country.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEDoddLewis2003531_363-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEDoddLewis2003531-363">[357]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGough1986_366-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGough1986-366">[360]</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Urbanisation">Urbanisation</span></h3>\n<div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Vietnam" title="List of cities in Vietnam">List of cities in Vietnam</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tnone" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right:auto; width:auto; max-width:1808px;">\n<div class="thumbinner"><div class="noresize overflowbugx" style="overflow:auto;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg" title="Ho Chi Minh City metro panorama, the city in Vietnam with the highest urbanisation rate."><img alt="Panorama of the Vietnamese city with high urbanisation rate" data-file-height="696" data-file-width="4873" decoding="async" height="257" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg/1800px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg/2700px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg/3600px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg 2x" width="1800"/></a></div><div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Wikivoyage_banner.jpg" title="File:Ho Chi Minh City Wikivoyage banner.jpg"> </a></div>Ho Chi Minh City metro panorama, the city in Vietnam with the highest urbanisation rate.</div>\n</div></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_(night).jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1815" data-file-width="3304" decoding="async" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg/300px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg/450px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg/600px-Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_%28night%29.jpg 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ho_Chi_Minh_City_Skyline_(night).jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/District_1,_Ho_Chi_Minh_City" title="District 1, Ho Chi Minh City">District 1</a>, Ho Chi Minh City.</div></div></div>\n<p>The number of people live in urbanised area in 2017 is estimated to be around 32.753 million of people (with urbanisation rate at 35.7%).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWorld_Bank2018b_367-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWorld_Bank2018b-367">[361]</a></sup> Since 1986, Vietnam\'s urbanisation rates have surged rapidly after the Vietnamese government implemented the &#272;&#7893;i M&#7899;i economic program, changing the system into socialist and liberalising property rights. As a result, Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City (the two major cities in the Red River Delta and Southeast regions respectively) increased their share of the total urban population from 8.5% and 24.9% to 15.9% and 31% respectively.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009b117_368-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009b117-368">[362]</a></sup> The Vietnamese government through its <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Construction_(Vietnam)" title="Ministry of Construction (Vietnam)">construction ministry</a> forecasts that the country will have a 45% urbanisation rates by 2020 with urbanisation is said to have a positive correlation with economic growth as any country with higher urbanisation rates would have a higher growth rate of GDP.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWorld_Bank2002_369-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWorld_Bank2002-369">[363]</a></sup> Furthermore, the urbanisation movements in Vietnam is mainly between the rural areas and the country Southeast region. Ho Chi Minh City has received a large population of in-migrants mainly due to better weather and economic opportunities.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009b102_370-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVietnam_General_Statistics_Office2009b102-370">[364]</a></sup>\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="680" data-file-width="1024" decoding="async" height="146" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg/220px-Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg/330px-Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg/440px-Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Hanoi_urbanisation_seen_from_Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Parts of Hanoi urbanisation as seen from <a href="/wiki/Tr%C3%BAc_B%E1%BA%A1ch_Lake" title="Tr&#250;c B&#7841;ch Lake">Tr&#250;c B&#7841;ch Lake</a>.</div></div></div>\n<p>A study also shows that rural-to-urban area migrants have a higher standards of living than both non-migrants in rural areas and non-migrants in urban areas which also leads to changing in economic structures. In 1985, agriculture took up 37.2% of Vietnam&#8217;s GDP; nevertheless, in 2008, that number went down to 18.5%, a decreasing of 18.7%.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194_371-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194-371">[365]</a></sup> In 1985, industry took only a small fraction of Vietnam GDP, around 26.2%. But in 2008, that number has increased up to 43.2%. Urbanisation also helps to improve basic services which increase people&#8217;s standards of living. Access to electricity has increased tremendously from 14% of total households&#160;having electricity in 1993 to above 96% in 2009.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194_371-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194-371">[365]</a></sup> In terms of accessing to fresh water, data from 65 utility companies show that only 12% of households in the area covered by the companies had access to the water network in 2002. By 2007, more than 70% of the population in the area was connected. Though urbanisation has many benefits, it has some drawbacks since it creates more traffic, air and water pollution.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194_371-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194-371">[365]</a></sup>\n</p><p>Since Vietnam has a big consumption of <a href="/wiki/Moped" title="Moped">mopeds</a> in their transportation due to the relatively cheap and easy to commute, large numbers of mopeds have been known for causing traffic and air pollution in Vietnam. In the capital city alone, the consumption of mopeds has increased from 0.5 million in 2001 to 4.7 million in 2013.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194_371-3"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECiraDasturKilroyLozano2011194-371">[365]</a></sup> With the rapid development, factories have sprung up rapidly which indirectly polluting air and water as been exampled from the <a href="/wiki/2016_Vietnam_marine_life_disaster" title="2016 Vietnam marine life disaster">2016 Vietnam marine life disaster</a> caused by the <a href="/wiki/Formosa_Ha_Tinh_Steel" title="Formosa Ha Tinh Steel">Formosa Ha Tinh Steel Company</a> which killing many fish and marine habitats in Vietnamese waters and directly causing major losses to the country economy.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTETiezzi2016_372-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTETiezzi2016-372">[366]</a></sup> There are some government\'s interventions and solutions trying to decrease air pollution by decreasing the number of motorcycles while increasing public transportation and having more regulations for factories to handle their <a href="/wiki/Waste" title="Waste">wastes</a>. Although the authorities also have a time schedules for collecting different types of waste, waste disposal have become another problem of urbanisation since the amount of solid waste generated in urban areas has increased unimaginably by more than 200% from 2003 to 2008. Industrial solid waste alone, took up 181% of that 200%. One of the government&#8217;s efforts is trying to promote campaigns to encourage the locals to sort <a href="/wiki/Municipal_solid_waste" title="Municipal solid waste">household waste</a> since <a href="/wiki/Waste_sorting" title="Waste sorting">waste sorting</a> are still not been practised entirely by most Vietnamese society.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTETr&#432;&#417;ng201819_373-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTETr&#432;&#417;ng201819-373">[367]</a></sup>\n</p>\n<table class="navbox">\n<tbody><tr>\n<th class="navbox-title" colspan="10"><div style="float:right; width:6em; height:2.6em">&#160;</div><div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="float: left;height:2.6em;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Largest_cities_of_Vietnam" title="Template:Largest cities of Vietnam"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Largest_cities_of_Vietnam" title="Template talk:Largest cities of Vietnam"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Largest_cities_of_Vietnam&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div> <div style="height:2.6em;line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:110%;">Largest <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Vietnam#Classification" title="List of cities in Vietnam">cities and municipalities</a> in Vietnam</span><br/><div style="display:inline;font-weight:normal;"><a class="external text" href="http://www.gso.gov.vn/default_en.aspx?tabid=515&amp;idmid=&amp;ItemID=16052" rel="nofollow">Vietnam General Statistics Office (2015)</a></div></div>\n</th></tr>\n<tr>\n<th></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Vietnam" title="List of cities in Vietnam">Rank</a>\n</th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Vietnam" title="List of cities in Vietnam">Name</a>\n</th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/Regions_of_the_Philippines" title="Regions of the Philippines">Region</a>\n</th>\n<th><a Minh City">H&#7891; Ch&#237; Minh City</a><br/><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:West_Hanoi.jpg" title="H&#224; N&#7897;i"><img alt="H&#224; N&#7897;i" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="624" href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Vietnam" title="Municipalities of Vietnam">Municipality Region</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">8,146,300</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">11</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Bu%C3%B4n_Ma_Thu%E1%BB%99t" title="Bu&#244;n Ma Thu&#7897;t">Bu&#244;n Ma Thu&#7897;t</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/%C4%90%E1%BA%AFk_L%E1%BA%AFk" title="&#272;&#7855;k L&#7855;k">&#272;&#7855;k L&#7855;k</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">340,000\n</td>\n<td rowspan="11" style="text-align: center"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg" title="H&#7843;i Ph&#242;ng"><img alt="H&#7843;i Ph&#242;ng" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1030" data-file-width="1572" decoding="async" height="79" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg/120px-13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg/180px-13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg/240px-13-HAIPHONG_INTERNATIONAL_EXHIBITION_CENTER.jpg 2x" width="120"/></a><br/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/H%E1%BA%A3i_Ph%C3%B2ng" title="H&#7843;i Ph&#242;ng">H&#7843;i Ph&#242;ng</a><br/><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG" title="&#272;&#224; N&#7861;ng"><img alt="&#272;&#224; N&#7861;ng" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="2304" data-file-width="3072" decoding="async" height="90" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG/120px-Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG/180px-Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG/240px-Da_Nang_skyline_Ong_Ich_Khiem.JPG 2x" width="120"/></a><br/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/%C4%90%C3%A0_N%E1%BA%B5ng" title="&#272;&#224; N&#7861;ng">&#272;&#224; N&#7861;ng</a>\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">2</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/H%C3%A0_N%E1%BB%99i" title="H&#224; N&#7897;i">H&#224; N&#7897;i</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Vietnam" title="Municipalities of Vietnam">Municipality Region</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">7,216,000</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">12</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Hu%E1%BA%BF" title="Hu&#7871;">Hu&#7871;</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Th%E1%BB%ABa_Thi%C3%AAn%E2%80%93Hu%E1%BA%BF" title="Th&#7915;a Thi&#234;n&#8211;Hu&#7871;">Th&#7915;a Thi&#234;n&#8211;Hu&#7871;</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">333,715\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">3</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/H%E1%BA%A3i_Ph%C3%B2ng" Nguy&#234;n">Th&#225;i Nguy&#234;n</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Th%C3%A1i_Nguy%C3%AAn" title="Th&#225;i Nguy&#234;n">Th&#225;i Nguy&#234;n</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">330,000\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">4</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" title="B&#224; R&#7883;a&#8211;V&#361;ng T&#224;u">B&#224; R&#7883;a&#8211;V&#361;ng T&#224;u</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">327,000\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">5</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/C%E1%BA%A7n_Th%C6%A1" title="C&#7847;n Th&#417;">C&#7847;n Th&#417;</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">15</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Quy_Nh%C6%A1n" title="Quy Nh&#417;n">Quy Nh&#417;n</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/B%C3%ACnh_%C4%90%E1%BB%8Bnh" title="B&#236;nh &#272;&#7883;nh">B&#236;nh &#272;&#7883;nh</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">311,000\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">6</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Bi%C3%AAn_H%C3%B2a" title="Bi&#234;n H&#242;a">Bi&#234;n H&#242;a</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/%C4%90%E1%BB%93ng_Nai" title="&#272;&#7891;ng Nai">&#272;&#7891;ng Nai</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">1,104,495</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">16</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Long_Xuy%C3%AAn" title="Long Xuy&#234;n">Long Xuy&#234;n</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/An_Giang" title="An Giang">An Giang</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">280,300\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">7</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Nha_Trang" title="Nha Trang">Nha Trang</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Kh%C3%A1nh_H%C3%B2a_Province" title="Kh&#225;nh H&#242;a Province">Kh&#225;nh H&#242;a Province</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">792,397</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">17</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Vi%E1%BB%87t_Tr%C3%AC" title="Vi&#7879;t Tr&#236;">Vi&#7879;t Tr&#236;</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ph%C3%BA_Th%E1%BB%8D" title="Ph&#250; Th&#7885;">Ph&#250; Th&#7885;</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">277,539\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">8</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Vinh" title="Vinh">Vinh</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ngh%E1%BB%87_An" title="Ngh&#7879; An">Ngh&#7879; An</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">490,000</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">18</td>\n<td
