2018</a>.</span>\n</li>\n</ol></div>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes_and_references">Notes and references</span></h2>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h3>\n<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;">\n<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">\n<li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Also called Kinh people.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECommunist_Party_of_Vietnam2004_1-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECommunist_Party_of_Vietnam2004-1">[1]</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-6">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In effect since 1 January 2014.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Vietnam2014_5-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Vietnam2014-5">[4]</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-13">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The South China Sea is referred to in Vietnam as the East Sea (<i lang="vi" title="Vietnamese language text">Bi&#7875;n &#272;&#244;ng</i>).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECham2012_12-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECham2012-12">[10]</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-etymology-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-etymology_18-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-etymology_18-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">At first, <a href="/wiki/Gia_Long" title="Gia Long">Gia Long</a> requested the name "Nam Vi&#7879;t", but the <a href="/wiki/Jiaqing_Emperor" title="Jiaqing Emperor">Jiaqing Emperor</a> refused.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWoods200238_14-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWoods200238-14">[11]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEShaofeiGuoqing2016_17-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShaofeiGuoqing2016-17">[14]</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-108">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Neither the American government nor Ng&#244; &#272;&#236;nh Di&#7879;m\'s State of Vietnam signed anything at the 1954 Geneva Conference. The non-communist Vietnamese delegation objected strenuously to any division of Vietnam; however, the French accepted the Vi&#7879;t Minh proposal<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGravel1971134_104-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGravel1971134-104">[100]</a></sup> that Vietnam be united by elections under the supervision of "local commissions".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGravel1971119_105-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGravel1971119-105">[101]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a>, with the support of South Vietnam and the United Kingdom, countered with the "American Plan",<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGravel1971140_106-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGravel1971140-106">[102]</a></sup> which provided for <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a>-supervised unification elections. The plan, however, was rejected by <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet</a> and other communist delegations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEKort201796_107-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKort201796-107">[103]</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-area-159"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-area_159-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">See <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area" title="List of countries and dependencies by area">List of countries and dependencies by area</a>.</span>\n</li>\n</ol></div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h3>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Print">Print</span></h4>\n<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r853264625">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{list-style-type:none;margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>dl>dd{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em;list-style:none}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-100{font-size:100%}</style><div class="refbegin columns references-column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em;">\n<ul><li><cite class="citation book" id="CITEREFRichardson1876">Richardson, John (1876). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=GHYDAAAAQAAJ&amp;pg=PA269&amp;dq=french+settled+saigon+cochinchina#v=onepage&amp;q=french%20settled%20saigon%20cochinchina&amp;f=false" rel="nofollow"><i>A school manual of modern geography.
